item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

K. 11 day bump, but I think its worth it.

XHTML 1.1 Compliant Site (with divs, and perfect rendering in ie 6+7 and ff2):

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<!--[if IE]>
<style>
#everything{
  top:-15px;
}
</style>
<![endif]-->

<!--[if lte IE 6]>
<style>
#everything{
  background-image:none;
}
#banner{
  position:relative;
  top:-12px;
}
#navigation{
  position:relative;
  top:-12px;
}
#content{
  position:relative;
  top:-12px;
}
#sidebar{
  position:relative;
  top:-12px;
}
#newsrss{
  width:107px;
}
</style>
<![endif]-->
<title>QKKnotes</title>
</head>

<body>
<div id="everything">
  <div id="header"></div>
  <div id="banner"><img src="images/banner.jpg" alt="Welcome to QuikNotes." /></div>
  <div id="navigation"><a href="index.php">HOME</a> | <a href="index.php?nav=products">PRODUCTS</a> | <a href="index.php?nav=contact">CONTACT</a> | <a href="index.php?nav=faq">FAQ</a></div>
  <div id="bodyrow">
  <div id="content">
    <div id="yeawehaveit"><img src="images/yeawehaveit.gif" alt="Yea, we probably have it." /></div>
	<div id="allsubjects">
	  <div id="topleftsubject"><img src="images/ush1h.jpg" alt="u.s. history 1 h" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/sp3h.jpg" alt="spanish III h" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/pch.jpg" alt="precalc h" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/bioh.jpg" alt="biology h" /></div>
	  <div id="toprightsubject"><img src="images/physh.jpg" alt="physics h" /></div>
	  <div id="bottomleftsubject"><img src="images/ush2h.jpg" alt="u.s. history II h" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/f3h.jpg" alt="french III h" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/apcab.jpg" alt="ap calculus" /></div>
	  <div class="subject"><img src="images/chemh.jpg" alt="chemistry h" /></div>
	  <div id="bottomrightsubject"><img src="images/apchem.jpg" alt="ap chemistry" /></div>
	</div>
	<div id="subjectsbottom"><img src="images/subjectsbottom.gif" alt="" /></div>
	<div id="searchbox">
	  <div id="searchleft"><img src="images/searchleft.jpg" alt="Search for the right guide:" /></div>
	  <div id="search">
	    <form action="index.php">
		<fieldset id="searchfield">
		  <input type="text" value="Bob...lol" class="searchinput" /> <input type="submit" value="" class="searchsubmit" />
		</fieldset>
		</form>
	  </div>
	  <div id="searchright"><img src="images/searchright.jpg" alt="" /></div>
	</div>
	<div id="news">
	  <div id="newstitle"><img src="images/newstitle.gif" alt="news" /></div>
	  <div id="newsrow">
	    <div id="newsfeed">
	      <h1>AP Calculus Finals Guide Available</h1>
		  <hr />
		  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Cras pulvinar, ligula convallis dictum dignissim, magna urna blandit elit, semper mattis est elit vel urna. Duis enim magna, dictum ut, interdum et, consectetuer in, erat. Curabitur pulvinar eleifend dui. Nullam rhoncus commodo libero. Nulla justo. Sed lectus orci, laoreet eu, semper quis, lacinia ut, neque. Phasellus risus. Aliquam accumsan leo viverra nunc. Ut lacinia ligula vitae tellus. In tellus nisl, vehicula non, vehicula in, interdum feugiat, justo. Nam faucibus aliquam arcu. Praesent molestie posuere risus. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Suspendisse molestie neque ac libero. Quisque tincidunt nibh id mi. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Sed vulputate vestibulum risus.</p>
	    </div>
	    <div id="newsrss">
	      <p id="newscenter">subscribe through<br />rss/xml</p>
	    </div>
	    <div id="newsspace"></div>
	  </div>
	</div>
  </div>
  <div id="sidebar">
	<div id="latestproductstitle"><img src="images/latestproducts.jpg" alt="latest products" /></div>
	<div id="latestproductsinfo">
	<ul>
	  <li>AP Chem Midterm Guide</li>
	  <li>French III H Midterm Guide</li>
	  <li>Spanish IV H Chapter 21</li>
	  <li>Precalc H Chapter 7</li>
	  <li>U.S. History II H Ch 22</li>
	</ul>	
	</div>
	<div id="quickcommentstitle"><img src="images/quickcomments.jpg" alt="" /></div>
	<div id="quickcommentsinfo">
	<ul>
	  <li>James:  I'm making an awesome site.  You should check it out.</li>
	  <li>Harold:  nm, u?</li>
	  <li>James:  Yo, what up, Harold?</li>
	</ul>
	</div>
	<div id="hottestsellerstitle"><img src="images/hottestsellers.jpg" alt="" /></div>
	<div id="hottestsellersinfo">
	<ol>
	  <li>AP Chemistry Midterm Formula Guide</li>
	  <li>U.S. History II Honors Midterm Study Guide</li>
	</ol>
	</div>
  </div>
  <div id="bodyspace"></div>
  </div>
  <div id="footer">©2007 James Qian and Harold Kim.</div>
</div>
</body>
</html>

Its CSS file (compliant with 17 warnings):

/* CSS Document */

body{
	background-image:url(images/bg.gif);
	background-repeat:repeat;
	text-align:center;
	font-family:Tahoma, Verdana, Serif;
	font-size:10px;
	
}

a:link{
	background-color:transparent;
	color:#ffffff;
	text-decoration:none;
	border:0px #ffffff hidden;
	
}

a:visited{
	background-color:transparent;
	color:#ffffff;
	text-decoration:none;
	
}

a:hover{
	background-color:transparent;
	color:#cccccc;
	text-decoration:none;
	
}

a:active{
	background-color:transparent;
	color:#999999;
	text-decoration:underline;
	
}

hr{
	width:410px;
	margin:5px 0px 5px 0px;

}

h1{
	font-family:Verdana, Serif;
	font-size:14px;
	color:#666666;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	text-align:left;
	margin:0px;

}

p{
	font-family:Tahoma, Serif;
	font-size:10px;
	color:#666666;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	text-align:left;
	text-indent:20px;
	margin:0px 0px 5px 0px;
	
}

ul{
	margin-top:5px;
	margin-bottom:5px;
	
}

ol{
	margin-top:5px;
	margin-bottom:5px;
	
}

#everything{
	position:relative;
	width:840px;
	margin-left:auto;
	margin-right:auto;
	height:100%;
	text-align:center;
	visibility: visible;
	top:-8px;
	background-image:url(images/shadow.png);
	background-repeat:repeat-y;
	
}

#header{
	height:20px;
	width:800px;
	background-color:#e8e8e8;
	color:#ffffff;
	margin:0px auto 0px auto;
	color:#FF0000;
	position:relative;

}

#headspace{
	height:2px;
	width:800px;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#ff0000;
	margin:0px auto 0px auto;
	
}

#banner{
	height:80px;
	width:800px;
	padding:2px 0px 1px 0px;
	margin:0px auto 0px auto;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	
}

#navigation{
	height:17px;
	width:795px;
	background-color:#bfbfbf;
	color:#ffffff;
	margin:0px auto 0px auto;
	padding:3px 0px 0px 5px;
	text-align:left;
	font-weight:bold;
	font-family:Tahoma, Serif;
	font-size:10px;
	
}

#bodyrow{
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#666666;
	width:800px;
	margin-right:auto;
	margin-left:auto;

}

#content{
	width:570px;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#333333;
	padding:15px 0px 15px 15px;
	float:left;
	
}

#yeawehaveit{
	width:550px;
	height:41px;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#cccccc;
	margin:0px 0px 1px 0px;
	float:left;

}

#allsubjects{
	width:550px;
	height:101px;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#ffffff;
	float:left;
	
	
}

#topleftsubject{
	width:110px;
	height:50px;
	clear:left;
	float:left;
	margin:0px 1px 1px 0px;
	
}

.subject{
	width:110px;
	height:50px;
	float:left;
	margin:0px 1px 1px 0px;

}

#toprightsubject{
	width:106px;
	height:50px;
	clear:right;
	float:left;
	margin:0px 0px 1px 0px;

}

#bottomleftsubject{
	width:110px;
	height:50px;
	clear:left;
	float:left;
	margin:0px 1px 1px 0px;

}

#bottomrightsubject{
	width:106px;
	height:50px;
	clear:right;
	float:left;
	margin:0px 0px 1px 0px;

}

#subjectsbottom{
	width:550px;
	height:30px;
	float:left;
	margin:1px 0px 0px 0px;
	
}

#searchbox{
	margin:15px 0px 0px 0px;
	width:550px;
	height:60px;
	float:left;

}

#searchleft{
	width:135px;
	height:60px;
	float:left;
	clear:left;
	margin:0px 0px 0px 0px;
	
}

#search{
	width:404px;
	height:60px;
	background-image:url(images/searchbg.gif);
	background-repeat:repeat-x;
	float:left;
	
}

#searchfield{
	border:0px none #ffffff;
	
}

input.searchinput{
	margin:15px 0px auto 0px;
	height:20px;
	width:300px;
	border:1px solid #666666;
	
}

input.searchsubmit{
	margin:15px 0px auto 0px;
	background-image:url(images/searchbutton.gif);
	background-repeat:no-repeat;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	height:18px;
	width:52px;
	border:0px none #000000;
	
}

#searchright{
	float:left;
	height:60px;
	width:11px;

}

#news{
	float:left;
	width:550px;
	margin:15px 0px 0px 0px;
	
}

#newstitle{
	width:550px;
	height:30px;
	float:left;
	
}

#newsrow{
	background-color:#efefef;
	border-width:0px 1px 1px 1px;
	border-color:#b9b9b9 #b9b9b9 #b9b9b9 #b9b9b9;
	border-style:solid;

}

#newsfeed{
	padding:0px 15px 15px 15px;
	width:400px;
	float:left;
	clear:left;
	border:0px #ffffff hidden;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	color:#666666;
	
}

#newsrss{
	float:left;
	width:118px;
	background-color:#efefef;
	
}

#newsspace{
	clear:both;
	
}

#newscenter{
	text-align:center;
	text-indent:0px;
	background-color:#efefef;
	color:#666666;
	margin:10px 0px 0px 0px;
	
}

#sidebar{
	padding:15px 15px 15px 0px;
	float:left;
	width:185px;
	color:#666666;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	text-align:left;
	
}

#latestproductstitle{
	width:200px;
	height:30px;
	float:left;
	clear:both;
	
}

#latestproductsinfo{
	width:200px;
	background-color:#e8e8e8;
	float:left;

}

#quickcommentstitle{
	width:200px;
	height:30px;
	float:left;
	clear:both;
	
}

#quickcommentsinfo{
	width:200px;
	background-color:#e8e8e8;
	float:left;
	
}

#hottestsellerstitle{
	width:200px;
	height:30px;
	float:left;
	clear:both;
	
}

#hottestsellersinfo{
	width:200px;
	background-color:#e8e8e8;
	float:left;
	
}

#bodyspace{
	clear:both;

}

#footer{
	width:800px;
	background-color:#ffffff;
	margin-right:auto;
	margin-left:auto;
	text-align:center;

}

#contentspace{
	clear:both;
	
}

Read full topic

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

[quote=“Enum, post:21, topic:30841”][quote author=alexia link=topic=45073.msg624873#msg624873 date=1166227181]

i hate divs

tables make more sense to me since i can manipulate them anyway i want because ive worked with them so much

Doesn’t mean that divs are worse… just means that you are too lazy to learn how to use them.

-Alexia
[/quote]

The divs against tables argument is a common debate. In my opinion use what you know.Also nice guide but it sadly only scratches the surface.[/quote]

True. This guide was mainly for new people to web design. I may make a more complete one in a week or so, but I am not sure.

-Alexia

Read full topic

1337h4x:

That’s why its a shitty example.

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Enum Enum
item.description:
@Enum wrote:

[quote=“alexia, post:9, topic:30841”][quote author=Bang Train link=topic=45073.msg551389#msg551389 date=1164945211]
i hate divs

tables make more sense to me since i can manipulate them anyway i want because ive worked with them so much
[/quote]

Doesn’t mean that divs are worse… just means that you are too lazy to learn how to use them.

-Alexia[/quote]

The divs against tables argument is a common debate. In my opinion use what you know.Also nice guide but it sadly only scratches the surface.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It’s hardly “cleaner”, though.

If you are following the XHTML philosophy and aiming for cleanness, you shouldn’t have those tables.

Now give me an example of something like that in Xhtml. Thanks for staying with me.

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

It’s cleaner. You can look down on people who are stuck in the 20th century with their HTML 4.0 standards.
Here’s a shitty example of what I mean.

[code]

My Personal Site - Sneamia.net
 "Frailty, thy name is woman! - Shakespeare"
Menu News Announcements
 Home
<?php include 'news/news.php'; ?>

 Site 1.1 is up

 Site 1.0 is up

 Site 0.5 is up.
 Forums
 About
 School
 Media
 Links
Info

Design by James

Hosted by 1and1
 

Copyright 2006 by James Qian. RSS

  
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

NONONO I know about the css shit, I’ve made tons of css rich sites, but I im asking you guys to cut the crap and tell me why I should switch to xhtml.

Read full topic

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

1337h4x:

Is closing uncclosable tags the only difference between xhtml and html?

HELL NO. XHTML is much cleaner, in many more ways. Alexia didn’t stress this enough, but XHTML is what HTML was built for. XHTML is the information. CSS is the style. Get rid of a stylesheet, and your site should look like shit. If it doesn’t, its not XHTML.

Read full topic

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Is closing uncclosable tags the only difference between xhtml and html?

Read full topic

item.description:

I think css it looks better with indenting, but w/e, its a matter of personal preference.

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

alexia:

xHTML is a newer form of HTML. Everything in xHTML is set to be more proper coding. Before starting with xHTML, you should probably be at least a little familiar with HTML.

I firmly disagree. XHTML should be the first thing a new learner should learn. Bad habits are bad habits, and will remain bad habits. If they learn to not worry about closing their

tags, then it will be much harder to continue to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Alexia's xHTML / CSS Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

I disagree with one thing...even in html, even though it is not strictly enforced, divs layouts are still the proper method opoosed to tables. Xhtml impresses that fact far more though.
Oh... Sorry. I only used HTML for like 8 days before I went to xHTML, and that was about 4 years ago, so I don't remember much. :P
But besides that, its a very nice tutorial. Thanks for posting
No problem.

-Alexia

Read full topic

But besides that, its a very nice tutorial. Thanks for posting
